description.value:
Trigger A sapient living creature enters or is placed inside the fungal forge, a fungal forge takes damage, or an attempt to disable a forge critically fails

Effect The fungal forge floods its interior with sickly green demonic energy that looks like a mix of fluid and fog. A creature within the fungal forge takes 5d8 variable damage and 5d8 void damage as their soul withers and their flesh decays, while a creature within 20 feet of the forge is exposed to vented unholy energy and only takes the void damage as their flesh rotsâ€”in either case, an affected creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save. The type of non-void damage a fungal forge inflicts on those within varies. The green forge (D6a) deals cold damage, the yellow one (D6b) poison damage, the orange one (D6c) acid damage, the black one (D6d) electricity damage, and the purple one (D6e) mental damage. Demons and fungi are immune to this effect entirely.

Green: @Damage[5d8[cold],5d8[void]]

Yellow: @Damage[5d8[poison],5d8[void]]

Orange: @Damage[5d8[acid],5d8[void]]

Black: @Damage[5d8[electricity],5d8[void]]

Purple: @Damage[5d8[mental],5d8[void]]

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage. If the creature is inside the fungal forge, they also become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 1} with an unlimited duration.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage. If the creature is inside the fungal forge, they also become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Enfeebled]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2} with an unlimited duration.

stealth.details: A fifteen-foot diameter spherical fungus with a five-foot-diameter circular aperture facing into the room; inside the fungus lie partially decayed humanoid remains.

publication.title: Pathfinder #212: A Voice in the Blight

details.reset: A fungal forge resets immediately at the start of every round, and immediately triggers again if there are still sapient creatures within it.
